Statistics is a powerful, fascinating, and elegant science and I enjoy sharing this with others through teaching. In addition to being a TF/TA for many courses I was formerly a Departmental Teaching Fellow at Harvard.

NYU Short Courses:
  • Data Science and Social Science (January 2016, with Pablo Barberá)
    • Course materials
NYU Courses as Project Advisor:
  • DS-GA 10060: Data Science Capstone (Fall 2015)
Harvard Courses as Teaching Fellow:
  • STAT 303: The Art and Practice of Teaching Statistics (AY 2013-14)
  • STAT 98: Junior Tutorial (Spring 2013)
  • STAT 139: Linear Models (Fall 2012)
  • STAT 104: Quantitative Methods for Economics (Spring 2012)
  • STAT 101: Intro to Quantitative Methods for Social Sciences (Fall 2011)
  • EMR 16: Real Life Statistics (Summer 2011)
Awards:
  • 4 times awarded certificate for distinction in teaching by Harvard's Derek Bok Center
  • David Pickard Memorial Teaching Fellow
